attribs.name: repeating_proficiencies_-LHAWes7MLSYeXfT682O_name
attribs.current: Simple, dagger, rapier, shortsword, shortbow, handaxe, boomerang

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHAXwVaKd3YgJy7zNZs_description
attribs.current: When attacked by an attack of opportunity, you may use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that attack.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHAY84rOVr07Iho6UWn_description
attribs.current: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHAYDimMCb0fZRVxORj_description
attribs.current: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with small or smaller beasts.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHAYUt3Ue20l8PHZDIt_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d4, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 20/60,Weapon Damage: 2

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHAZMbtYGoBo39aMReA_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHAZZd44v73ydQkkqV8_description
attribs.current: If I am in town with a headquarters for my guild and am in good standing with the guild, I will be allowed to find jobs to earn money. My guild will support me if I am accused of a crime.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHMPNYX375ECorPm2G-_description
attribs.current:
+1 DEX

While you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and nothing in the other hand, you deal an extra +2 damage with the weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHMR4AtWFsZfMD-Lk9D_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing,Melee Damage: 2,Melee Damage: 2,Melee Damage: 2

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHoOJPXZMJfOe0CTg7t_description
attribs.current: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHoOuTSX8Kfyn6lU0Zy_description
attribs.current:
Monk weapons are shortswords + any simple melee weapons that aren't two-handed or heavy.

    You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and monk weapons.
    You can roll a d4 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike or monk weapon. This die changes as you gain monk levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the Monk table.
    When you use the Attack action with an unarmed strike or a monk weapon on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action. For example, if you take the Attack action and attack with a quarterstaff, you can also make an unarmed strike as a bonus action, assuming you haven't already taken a bonus action this turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHoP-t36XPP97FWnPuo_description
attribs.current:
Ki max = Monk Level

When you spend a ki point, it is unavailable until you finish a short or long rest, at the end of which you draw all of your expended ki back into yourself. You must spend at least 30 minutes of the rest meditating to regain your ki points.

Some of your ki features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Ki save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHoPAb0-AZrizUs9duK_description
attribs.current: Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action, or two strikes with my spirit weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHoPIeyGoVPJKDUpiY3_description
attribs.current: You can spend 1 ki point to take the Dodge action as a bonus action on your turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHoPO1a4aSAlHvVUQMJ_description
attribs.current: You can spend 1 ki point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action on your turn, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHoPnQHxGFXthpNt1pQ_description
attribs.current:
Your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield. This bonus increases when you reach certain monk levels, as shown in the Monk table.

At 9th level, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHoPvoz98EUlG4ZI3cY_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you can catch the missile if it is small enough for you to hold in one hand and you have at least one hand free. If you catch a missile in this way, you can spend 1 ki point to make a ranged attack (range 20/60 feet) with the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught, as part of the same reaction. You make this attack with proficiency, regardless of your weapon proficiencies, and the missile counts as a monk weapon for the attack.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHoQuIHTcWOFwKhYVgD_description
attribs.current:
You carry the sheath of a rapier. As a bonus action, you can corporealize the spirit blade by making a motion to draw it from its sheath. The weapon appears in your hand, and counts as a monk weapon for you. The next melee attack you make with it is at advantage and deals extra damage equal to your WIS mod. 

Also as a bonus action, I can move the weapon up to 20 feet away and make a melee weapon attack with it. When I use Flurry of Blows, I can move the weapon and make two weapon attacks with it instead of unarmed strikes. Attacks made while the weapon is floating deal martial die + DEX mod damage.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHtmyZTcWNaySYKN-kO_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHtmyZTcWNaySYKN-kO_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 80/320

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHtn5kaEbNEuQxYgfQI_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHtnbVyQga-ypibbxfl_itemcontent
attribs.current:
The jewels in the insignia of the Cult of the Dragon flare with purple light when you enter combat, empowering your natural fists or natural weapons.
While wearing the insignia you gain a +1 bonus to the attack rolls and the damage rolls you make with unarmed strikes and natural weapons. Such attacks are considered to be magical.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LI1fr6BHzZQyWsnQMy9_description
attribs.current: You can use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your monk level.
